subclusters.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
Mitochondrial ROS and Functional Decline Theory of Aging
Oxidative Stress-Induced Telomere Attrition Theory of Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage specifically to DNA, accumulation of oxidative DNA lesions, and their repair as causal in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative damage accumulation to biomolecules including DNA and the role of antioxidants in mitigating this damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced oxidative damage and the role of antioxidant enzymes like CuZnSOD in modulating DNA and cellular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative damage to biomolecules and the role of antioxidant enzymes (peroxiredoxins) in repairing oxidative damage and promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses oxidative damage accumulation and the interplay between endogenous antioxidant defenses and exogenous antioxidant supplementation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage to proteins and the repair of oxidized methionine residues by MSRA as a mechanism to reduce aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS as causal agents of aging and antioxidant molecules mitigating intracellular ROS to prevent physiological decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage to DNA and other biomolecules, and the feedback loop of mitochondrial damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS-induced oxidative protein damage, accumulation of protein carbonyls, and impaired protein quality control in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes free radical production causing oxidative damage to cellular components and decline of antioxidant defenses with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, and the balance between pro-oxidants and antioxidants in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS as key sources of oxidative damage leading to cellular dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced damage accumulation, antioxidant defenses, mitochondrial involvement, and programmed cell death in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates chronic oxidative stress with inflammation and immunosenescence as drivers of systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on host-derived oxidant cytotoxic agents, mitochondrial dysfunction, and inflammaging as interconnected aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant defense decline, apoptosis, and klotho gene regulation to aging and cognitive decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress imbalance, antioxidant defense decline, and intervention by antioxidant supplementation to reduce aging-related decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Regulated Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes Nrf2 as master regulator of antioxidant and immune genes controlling oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Driven Insulin Signaling Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced pancreatic angiogenesis, hyperinsulinemia, and insulin/IGF-1 signaling activation driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Functional Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS accumulation, SOD2 antioxidant defense, and stochastic parallel organ failure in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Functional Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitohormesis where moderate ROS exposure induces adaptive mitochondrial responses affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Functional Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS as signaling molecules regulating neuronal plasticity and homeostasis, linking ROS to functional maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Functional Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced mitochondrial dysfunction and vascular hypoperfusion as key initiators of brain aging and Alzheimer disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Telomere Attrition Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress accelerating telomere shortening, driving cellular senescence and organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Telomere Attrition Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative DNA damage at telomeres, repair mechanisms, and cross-talk with mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.
